arm_group.description: patients will undergo a primary transmastoid and tegmen mini-craniotomy cartilage cap occlusion surgery.
patients meet the same criteria but will elect not to undergo surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this study is to measure objective, functional outcomes of patients
      undergoing cartilage cap occlusion surgery for a dehiscent superior semicircular canal.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vestibular Function Outcome After Cartilage Cap Occlusion Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
One option for managing a dehiscent superior semicircular canal is surgical intervention.
      One of the surgical techniques is the transmastoid and tegmen mini-craniotomy cartilage cap
      occlusion of the dehiscent superior semicircular canal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ambulatory

          -  independent self-sufficient adults

          -  good general health

          -  medically stable

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Medically unstable

          -  pregnant

intervention.description: placement of a cartilage cap over the dome of the superior semicircular canal through a combined transmastoid and tegmen mini- craniotomy approach.

clinical_study.official_title: Objective Assessment of Vestibular Function Outcome After Cartilage Cap Occlusion Surgery for Dehiscent Superior Semicircular Canal

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure will be the subsequent (3 month) FGA scores between the control group and the surgery group to assess any objective improvement attributable to surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Secondary objective outcome measures will be changes in conductive hearing loss and changes in cervical VEMP thresholds between the two groups at the 3-month interval. Secondary subjective outcome measures will be ABC Scale and VAS scores between the two groups at 3 months.

Secondary objective outcome measures will be changes in conductive hearing loss and changes in cervical VEMP thresholds between the two groups at the 3-month interval. Secondary subjective outcome measures will be ABC Scale and VAS scores between the two groups at 3 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
clinical_study.why_stopped: Changed to a retrospective chart review
